---
title: Accessible Astro Dashboard
description: A fully accessible dashboard theme built with Astro and accessibility in mind.
---

import { Aside, Badge, FileTree, Steps } from '@astrojs/starlight/components';

## Introduction

The [Accessible Astro Dashboard](https://github.com/incluud/accessible-astro-dashboard) is a comprehensive admin dashboard theme that includes a login system, dashboard overview, and various admin pages. It's built with accessibility in mind and includes numerous utility classes and design system primitives.

<div class="flex gap-2 mb-8">
  <a href="https://github.com/incluud/accessible-astro-dashboard" class="sl-flex">GitHub Repository</a>
  <a href="https://accessible-astro-dashboard.incluud.dev/" class="sl-flex">Live Demo</a>
</div>

<Aside type="caution" title="Hackaton project">
  This project was created as a submission for the [Astro Hackathon 2022](https://hackathon-1-0-projects.vercel.app/theme/accessible-astro-dashboard). As such there are some features that are not yet implemented. We are planning on updating the project to a production-ready state in the future.
</Aside>

## Key features

- Login system with authentication example
- Dashboard overview with customizable widgets
- Admin pages (Media, Messages, Products, Settings, Users)
- Keyboard accessible sidebar navigation
- Collapsible sidebar with localStorage preference
- Dark mode with system preference detection
- Responsive design with mobile navigation
- Design system utilities and primitives
- Tailwind CSS integration <Badge text="Not implemented yet" variant="caution" />
- Excellent Lighthouse scores
- ESLint with strict accessibility settings <Badge text="Not implemented yet" variant="caution" />

## Accessibility features

- Semantic HTML landmarks
- Skip links navigation
- Keyboard accessible navigation (arrow keys, escape key)
- Screen reader friendly components
- Focus management and trap for modals
- Proper ARIA attributes and landmarks
- High contrast mode support <Badge text="Not implemented yet" variant="caution" />
- Reduced motion preferences <Badge text="Not implemented yet" variant="caution" />
- Clear focus indicators
- Screen reader only text utilities
- Proper heading hierarchy

<Aside type="tip" title="Authentication">
  The demo includes a basic authentication system. Use these credentials to log in:
  - Email: `admin@astro.demo`
  - Password: `Astronaut570`
</Aside>

## Getting started

<Steps>
1. Clone the repository:
   ```bash
   git clone https://github.com/incluud/accessible-astro-dashboard.git
   ```

2. Install dependencies:
   ```bash
   npm install
   ```

3. Start development server:
   ```bash
   npm run dev
   ```

4. Open your browser:
   Visit `http://localhost:4321` and log in with the demo credentials.
</Steps>

<Aside type="tip" title="GitHub Template">
  The dashboard is also available as a GitHub template. You can use it to create a new project by clicking the "Use this template" button in the repository.
</Aside>

## Project structure

The dashboard follows a clear and organized structure:

<FileTree>
- public/
  - ... // Other assets
- src/
  - assets/
    - img/ // Contains the logo
    - scss/
      - base/ _// Core styles and utilities_
  - components/
    - DashboardWidget.astro
    - EmptyState.astro
    - LoginForm.astro
    - Navigation.astro
    - ResponsiveToggle.astro
  - layouts/
    - DefaultLayout.astro _// Default page layout_
    - LoginLayout.astro _// Login page layout_
  - pages/
    - 404.astro
    - index.astro
    - login.astro // Login page
    - media.astro
    - messages.astro
    - products.astro
    - settings.astro
    - users.astro
- package.json
- astro.config.mjs
</FileTree>

## Components

The dashboard includes several specialized components:

- `DashboardWidget.astro` - Customizable dashboard widgets
- `EmptyState.astro` - Placeholder for empty data states
- `LoginForm.astro` - Accessible login form with validation
- `Navigation.astro` - Collapsible sidebar navigation
- `ResponsiveToggle.astro` - Mobile navigation toggle

## Customization

The theme includes a comprehensive design system:

<FileTree>
- src/
  - assets/
    - scss/
      - base/
        - _reset.scss _// CSS reset_
        - _grid.scss _// Grid system_
        - _color.scss _// Color system_
        - _font.scss _// Font styles_
        - _space.scss _// Space scale_
        - _elevation.scss _// Box shadows_
</FileTree>

### Example usage

```astro
<div class="grid">
  <div class="small-12 medium-3">
    <div class="space-32 radius-large elevation-400">
      <h3>Dashboard Widget</h3>
      <!-- Widget content -->
    </div>
  </div>
</div>
```

<Aside type="note" title="SSR support">
  While the demo uses SSG for simplicity, it's recommended to use Astro's SSR capabilities for proper authentication in production.
</Aside>

## Contributing

<Steps>
1. Fork the repository on GitHub

2. Create a new branch:
   ```bash
   git checkout -b feat/your-feature-name
   ```

3. Make your changes and commit them:
   ```bash
   git commit -m "Add some feature"
   ```

4. Push to your fork:
   ```bash
   git push origin feat/your-feature-name
   ```

5. Open a Pull Request on GitHub
</Steps>

<Aside type="tip" title="Best practice">
  When customizing the dashboard, maintain the accessibility features and test with screen readers and keyboard navigation.
</Aside>
